author: Jeff Knox
comment: I left a bad review when the app stopped working after AW 2.0 came out. All it took was a reinstall and it works great. Lets me see exactly what's installed on my wearable, and remove apps all in one place. I like it a lot, seems indispensable for managing my watch.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Glad to hear you got it sorted. Sounds like our app may not have handled the upgrade process well? We'll look into that - thanks for the heads-up!

author: Twisted World
comment: Great app! I love managing what's on my watch using the big screen of my PadFone rather than the small round display on my ZenWatch. The only bug I came across so far is that the app will claim "Not found on wearable" for pretty much every app that absolutely IS on my wearable.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: It obviously shouldn't be doing that, but it's difficult to tell why it is from here. Tapping the Refresh button may kick-start it; otherwise, please email and we'd be glad to work with you to solve it.

author: Halvor Remole
comment: It's ridiculous Google didn't include this functionality with wear 2.0. I do wish I could filter apps based upon install location. You already have that column mode, perhaps a single column each for installed on phone, watch, and both?

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion. I'm planning something like this for a future release, but am not sure of the best way to do it just yet!

author: John Hewer
comment: Really good for managing watch faces that sit on the watch and either don't install or uninstall appropriately.

author: Mark Wagie
comment: "No response from wearable app."

author: steve robbins
comment: Well this app is pretty much useless. Duplicates uninstall features built in your app drawer. Guess it's good for noobs.. A waste of money for me...

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Sorry the app's not for you. If you email us we can arrange a refund (can't do it through here).

author: Farkas Gabor
comment: Almost completely useless. During uninstall of wear apps, clearing app data is not even an option. This way your uninstaller app leaves a lot of junk on the Android Wear watch!

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: If an app keeps its data where it should, it will get deleted on uninstall. Unfortunately, many apps are poorly written and leave data in nonstandard places, and then the uninstaller has no way to find it. You'd do better to contact the dev of the app that left the junk - they're the only ones in a position to fix this.

author: anant kandpal
comment: Buggy qpp

author: Austere Alex
comment: It not much different than the storage view from Android wear.. I mean I only see the installed apps and cannot uninstall not one of them. I have some apps from wearable software and could no uninstall them using this app. I had to factory reset the watch to get rid of them..
title: Not good at all

comment: Pretty good, but I was expecting being able to remove apps *from the watch*. Apparently, the ones that can be removed at all are removed from both the watch and the phone, which is not necessarily what I need. --- Correction: Yes, it is clear from the description that uninstalling must be done from the app on the phone. What wasn't 100% clear is that it is not possible (most likely Google's brilliant design) to remove the watch component but still keep the phone app.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Uninstalling direct from the watch is coming with Wear 2.0 in Feb 2016, but until then it's just not possible, sorry. I've done my best to make this clear in the app description.

author: haans Ch
comment: sony Xa ultra + Huawei steel wear.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: The app description on the store listing clearly lays out its functionality. It also makes clear that uninstall directly from the watch is currently not possible for any Wear app. However, this will be coming with Wear 2.0 later this year.

author: Tyler Argyle
comment: I actually got this so I could get rid of the pesky "calling setup" app from my huaweii watch. It didn't identify it, and I figured it was a long shot anyway, but after using it for a little while I realized how handy and necessary something like this is since there is only limited space on wearables. 99 cents, while a typical cost for an app, is nearly a meaningless cost in the scope of things. I'll be keeping it.
title: Worth the 99 cents

author: Robbie P
comment: This does EXACTLY what it says it will do. Take a moment reading thru what you're installing before you slam or downgrade an app because you didn't understand or take the time to isn't fair to the dev. When Android wear 2.0 comes out in the fall you'll then be able to manage apps on your device directly as well as have it on both the phone and device. Until then, blame Google. But I like the app, and the fact I know what's actually ON my watch, whereas before I had no idea really. So kudos to the developer!
title: People need to READ about what they are installing

author: Craig Spreha
comment: All it does is uninstall the app off of your phone to remove it from the watch, you can do that yourself for free.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: The app's functionality is clearly explained in its store description. This includes how uninstall works, as well as everything else the app does (besides uninstall).

title: Waste if time

author: Thomas Parker
comment: The name of this app is very misleading.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: I'm sorry you find it so; the description lays out its functionality quite clearly. Email us (there's a link in the app's About screen) if you're unhappy with your purchase and would like a refund.

title: Misleading name

author: Thomas Jose
comment: This uninstalls the app from the phone and watch. Pointless.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Uninstall directly from the watch is currently not possible for any Wear app (as the app description clearly states). However, this will be coming with Wear 2.0 later this year - thanks for your patience!

title: Pointless

author: Bill VanDusen
comment: Found some things that I didn't even know were installed (thank you Verizon). Also easier to see what I have installed and decide if I still use that app or not, and let's me go to the Uninstaller and uninstall it.
title: Lots of information

author: paul richman
comment: Some watch faces marked as not on the watch are actually there. Some that are there don't show in your list. The sort order "last update date/time" does not reflect notifications I get about watch updates, but the notifications may be misleading.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for letting us know about this issue. We'll look into it for the next release.

title: Nice but...

author: Randy Bolton
comment: When I first started using Android Wear I was dismayed to learn that it is impossible to keep apps from downloading to your watch. This app at least lets me track the current status of these apps on my phone and watch. Well done.
title: Useful app for Android Wear app management!

author: Keith Holmes
comment: I have refresh 1 to 5 times to get it to connect to the watch. Then it works, but what a hassle! It is already paired and working flawlessly but just not connecting
title: Great app but..  .

author: Jonathan LaRocque
comment: The app is still useful for getting info on wear apps. The wording in the play store listing makes the user believe that one can "remove the wear apps that one is not using". You should clearly state, at the top of the listing, that this also uninstalls the phone app; not buried as a disclaimer at the bottom of the listing.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: We are adjusting the app description to make this even more clear and obvious.

title: Wording in description is misleading but...

author: Larry Moran
comment: Not much use other than the cool knowledge of some technical aspects of your apps.  The claim "Easily uninstall ones you're not using" is true, but not really.  I'd love to get rid of junk like Amazon, Play Music, Translate, etc. and this app will help you get rid of them....but on your phone also!  I can do that without this app.  Really not useful, definitely not worth the .99.  Uninstalling now.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: It isn't possible to uninstall apps just from the smartwatch, not the phone  (and we do not claim that this app will do so). Even if it could, the Android Wear system would put the uninstalled app back as soon as it noticed it was gone. This is a shortcoming of Android Wear, not of the app.

author: Blake Daniels-Britton
comment: This app does not just uninstall apps from your wear device, but also from your phone as well.  Maybe instead of having language that suggests that It can be removed from just the wear device, you further clarify that it can only be removed from both.  Until then, my review at 2 stars stands.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content:
Here's the wording that is currently used in the Store listing:
"PLEASE NOTE: this app does NOT support installing or uninstalling apps directly to and from your Wear device. The Android Wear system requires that all app un/installation happens through your linked phone (or tablet). Thanks for your understanding!"

author: Ricardo Ludeke
comment: You can not uninstall apps that are only on the android wear device!  Says you can uninstall apps, but only apps from phone.  This makes no sense? Why list it as a feature if it isn't?

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: The app description makes it clear that WAM cannot remove anything directly from the watch. We are adjusting the app description to make this even more clear and obvious.

author: Jim Patteson
comment: I would like to see the app be able to remove apps from the watch. Only the watch.  Why does the watch take some of the apps from the phone? It took My Radar, now if I try to remove it from the watch, it takes it from.the phone as well......I have a zenwatch 2

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: I'm sorry, this just isn't possible on Android Wear. And even if we figured out a way to do it, the Wear system would put the watch app back as soon as it noticed it was gone. This isn't about our app, it's a limitation of the platform.

title: I like it, but.....

author: Jay DeShane
comment: Useless app.  Either crashes constantly, cannot connect to wearable app, or shows all apps as not found on wearable device.  Save your money.
I have this aeris weather app on the watch and not on the phone and i cant get rid of it, it doesnt show in this manager, but still on my moto 360 2nd gen
title: Still didnt show everything on the watch

author: Alawi Abdulwahab
comment: Is not connecting anymore with Smartphone 3 after marshmallow update

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the problem report. We'll be looking at this for the next update.

title: Waste

author: Vermund Vetnes
comment: This app cannot uninstall Wear App. It does NOT manage my wear apps.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Unfortunately it's not possible to uninstall apps just from the smartwatch (and at no point do we claim that this app will do so). Even if it could, the Android Wear system would put the uninstalled app back as soon as it noticed it was gone. Please don't downrate this app for a shortcoming of Android Wear - thanks!

author: Bruno Parent St-Gelais
comment: No response from wearable app

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Most likely that means that the Wear system hasn't installed the wearable component of our app onto your watch. Did you get a notification on the watch that it had been installed? If not, please try reinstalling the app, and if that doesn't work, email us directly (using the link on the app's About page) for more help. This isn't a support forum.

author: Brian Mulawka
comment: Used to be perfect,  no longer works at all after update.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: We released an update yesterday that should fix this problem. Please email us (there's a link in the app's About screen) if you're still having trouble. Thanks for your patience!

author: Matthew Bird
comment: Great app manager and does what it says on the tin..
title: Great.!

author: Eli Lisko
comment: Works as advertised.
title: Works

author: Dave Burbank
comment: I'm on day two of my Android Wear experience. I just installed Android Wear Manager and I can already tell it's a must-have app. I'm still trying to wrap my brain around how apps get installed on my Android Wear. Android Wear Manager takes the mystery out of that process. Among other useful benefits it let's me easily see which of my apps have installed Android Wear modules on my phone. It shows me how much space each app takes. It shows me what permissions each app is using. And it lets me launch the Android Wear version of the app directly. Nicely done!
title: Excellent app for new Android Wear user

author: John Blair
comment: As another reviewer stated, this is essential tool for the Android Wear ecosystem, and for understanding what is placing modules on the watch, on the phone etc. One issue I have with AW is the lack of control, many processes are hard coded, and not obvious to the  user what is being done. This takes some mystery out of that. The only major improvement I would love to see is a storage info, such as music etc, so watch storage could be managed. That would make this app perfect (if possible in the same application)

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: Thanks for the suggestion! We've got a long list of enhancements planned for the next few releases, but we'll see if we can fit this in somewhere.

title: Nice! Extremely Useful

author: Hunter Dinh
comment: It's really helpful to figure out if the apps are installed to my watch. I'm glad this is a must-have. I don't know why sometimes the app is installed yo my watch but the manager says its not, kinda odd.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: We are currently testing a new release. If this behaviour still happens after that, please email us directly at support@udellenterprises.com with some more details and we'll work on it.

title: Must have app

author: Robert Trzebiński
comment: Unfortunately I can not uninstall default apps from watch. I was trying to remove default trash apps added by Asus, but there is no way to do that. Apart from that it does the job.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: I agree, the app SHOULD have this option, but unfortunately it's simply impossible. Android Wear doesn't support the APIs required to uninstall apps on the watch from another app.

title: Works fine

author: Michael Arnold
comment: I bought this under the premise that we would be able to use this to sideload apks to android wear, not just view a list of available android wear apps, Google has ways to do this now. I even emailed the dev in OCT before I purchased asking if that was a feature. Dev responded with working on that now will have that feature put in soon. It's been almost a year.

reply.author: Udell Enterprises, Inc
reply.content: When you emailed, we said "We hope to have it in a future release if all works out." The unfortunate truth is that we've tried several different approaches to accomplish this, and nothing's worked yet. We'd still love to add this feature if we can find a way - and in the meanwhile, we have added MANY other features (beyond what Google offers).

title: I wonder if this is actually going to have the features we were told were coming

author: Charlie Shay
comment: Good for storage space management and monitor installation status of individual apps. It also functions like a quasi app launcher for phone and wear drives.
title: Very useful utility

author: David Traumann
comment: Another essential app that should be integrated in Android Wear in the first place. Thank you developers for taking care of that. Well worth the money.
title: Why doesn't it come as a system app?
